title: How many kinds of music are there? What are they? - Quora

response.answer_text: Seems to me there’s only two types of music: good and bad. Regardless of genre, music must appeal to the senses and the emotions in some way. If it doesn’t succeed, then for you it is bad. However, and it’s a big ‘however’, we are not all made the same way in terms of our emotional responses (I know, I’m stating the obvious) so what appeals to one person may not appeal to another. For myself, popular music must possess a good melody or at least have words that express feeling*. There have been masters of this kind of thing over the last century, for a few examples Rodgers and Hart, Rodgers and Hammerstein, Irving Berlin, George and Ira Gershwin, Cole porter, Burt Bacharach and Hal David. Then there’s the performer who can lift what might with the average singer become a mediocre song and turn it into a classic. An example of this is ‘That’s All’, as sung by Frank Sinatra. I’ve read somewhere or other that this song was considered to be one of the finest ever written, yet if you ignore the singer’s performance and listen to the melody, there’s very little of that other than a simple repeated phrase. Yet I’d agree - with the right singer, it is a great song. Performance can sometimes be all. Whether you like brass bands, country music, all and any form of classical music from string quartet to full orchestra, from soprano to choir, from jazz ensemble to big band, from rock to ballad, you will know when you hear something you like and for you, that will be good. I like some of all these genres. *Even if sung in a language you do not understand, like ‘In Trutina’ with words of ancient Latin. Pure magic.

There are literally about ten million genres of music (ok I exaggerate a little), but no joke… there are a lot of genres of music. Listing them all would take a week. So let me use someone else’ list Alternative Rock College Rock Crossover Thrash Crust Punk Experimental Rock Folk Punk Goth / Gothic Rock Darkwave Deathrock Grunge Hardcore Punk Hard Rock Indie Rock
